post.title: Make other people be the change you want to see in the world.

body:
For anyone that lived in the most liberal part of the country, this is so true it's scary. I've never seen such waste, littering and destruction of the environment as I have in Northern California.

Why is it that you get sick and lightheaded from the pollution in Los Angeles after spending a few hours outside? I remember the northeast corridor (NY/NJ/PA) of the seventies and current CA coast has them beat in terms of garbage and pollution. The place is goddamn disgusting

body: Place is a dump. I did an East to West road trip and LA was the place I was excited for the most since I love film. I got there and wasn't impressed at all, the place is a fucking dump. It's so run down and homeless everywhere, this was in 2014 and i heard it's even worse now. New Orleans and Austin were my favourite places. I couldn't get over how nice Austin was though and when I recommend it to people they don't believe me but it is a great city and worth visiting for a week.

post.title: Make other people be the change you want to see in the world.

body:
I once lived in a gentrified former ghetto all redone by corrupt city officials as a public art space.  A helmet haired white lesbian was telling me at the coffee house how they saved the neighborhood.  

I asked how she could use that word when the people who lived there for years didn't anymore and suggested "conquered" or "seized" orv"occupied" it was more accurate.  

Her face! Seemed like it never entered her mind or had ever been spoken to her

Her face! Seemed like it never entered her mind or had ever been spoken to her

body:
I grew up there, mid-70s to early-90s. It's always been a shitbox. It's just more of a shitbox and any semblance of resistance to hard-left politics has dried up and moved out of state.

Austin's always been "far left" in comparison to the rest of Texas, but is now alarmingly headed in that direction with the influx of Hollywood "personalities" and rank-and-file Californians, bound and determined to vote for the same idiotic policies that they fled when they left.

I've not spent enough time in New Orleans to formulate an opinion, but the food is out of this world good, I will say that.

post.title: Make other people be the change you want to see in the world.

body:
Nothing was ever a bigger disappointment than visiting Hollywood, CA. I had a friend that lived one block away from the Chinese theater so I was like "hell yeah!"

Get on bus and halfway through the trip (entire trip was 8 hours) I encounter super creepy dude that would later get off the bus with me at 2am and try to coax me to a nearby hotel to have sex with him. 

Boyfriend at the time was 30 min late so I had to sit an listen to creepers sex stories.

We all get up and walk up to the strip to get a something to eat. Omfg. The first thing that hit my nose was the sour smell of puke, piss, and shit. There was trash *everywhere* so the smell of rotting trash was also super thick. 

After we ate we decided to go down Hollywood Blvd. It was like experiencing real life pop-up ads. Every wannabe singer had their songs on blast shoving their CDs in your face. One guy even grabbed my arm and yelled into my face how he was the greatest thing since 2Pac. Religious nuts shoving pamphlets at you screeching about how the world was going to end soon. Bums that smelled to high heaven panhandling. Street performers that looked disheveled and tweaked out. It was a nightmare.

Last stop was to head back to the Chinese Theater. Lots of pushing and yelling because people were trying to get pictures in front of it and crouching in front of their favorite stars. 

Overall the day was awful and I just wanted to get out. So we head back and return for diner at night. Just like the day time but exponentially more sketch. More bums,  just mumbling and drunk, pissing on buildings and yelling at strangers. We get around to drinking back at friends place, we're all having a good time when out of nowhere... gunshots right outside the apartment and screeching tires. We look at my friend and she just shrugs like it nothing.

I could not wait to get out of there.

Edit: autocorrect error removed.

body: Imagine the energy consumption required to operate just *one* facebook data center. These are massive structures that consume billions of kilowatt hours of electricity, for a company that provides absolutely nothing of value. And there are dozens, of not a hundred of these all over the country

https://github.com/miyuchina/mistletoe

If you can read this you suck.

body:
The "progressive" "hippies" across the street from me throw their garden "waste" on my side of the street, and much of it is the edible plants that they don't harvest and instead let rot or just cut off and throw away when they get big. Instead, they buy their food from Trader Joe's and Whole Foods. Fucking posers.

I salvage what I can. I have a 3 pound bag of sunflower seeds that I need to roast.

And of course they have Black Lives Matter propaganda all over the front of their house, despite all of them being white.

The "progressive" "hippies" across the street from me throw their garden "waste" on my side of the street, and much of it is the edible plants that they don't harvest and instead let rot or just cut off and throw away when they get big. Instead, they buy their food from Trader Joe's and Whole Foods. Fucking posers.

I salvage what I can. I have a 3 pound bag of sunflower seeds that I need to roast.

And of course they have Black Lives Matter propaganda all over the front of their house, despite all of them being white.

post.title: Make other people be the change you want to see in the world.

body:
Nice meme OP.

Companies will always exist to entice people to buy products with zero regard for the environment and our resources, that is why ALL consumer ethics must start at the individual level. We have more power than you think. I can't control what a company in China does, but I don't have to buy their product either. 

But of course there will always be idiots that buy things impulsively. I think Nation Socialism could be very useful in this regard, because 90% of the useless garbage made today could have its production completely outlawed.
body_html:

But of course there will always be idiots that buy things impulsively. I think Nation Socialism could be very useful in this regard, because 90% of the useless garbage made today could have its production completely outlawed.

author.bio: so bad at memes, even worse at writing bio's
author.bio_html: so bad at memes, even worse at writing bio's

body: The you described LA is spot on. You're somewhere where it's just rotten and fool of creeps and then turn a corner into overcrowded streets with panhandlers everywhere! 10/10 description miss.
body_html: The you described LA is spot on. You're somewhere where it's just rotten and fool of creeps and then turn a corner into overcrowded streets with panhandlers everywhere! 10/10 description miss.

parent.body:
Nothing was ever a bigger disappointment than visiting Hollywood, CA. I had a friend that lived one block away from the Chinese theater so I was like "hell yeah!"

Get on bus and halfway through the trip (entire trip was 8 hours) I encounter super creepy dude that would later get off the bus with me at 2am and try to coax me to a nearby hotel to have sex with him. 

Boyfriend at the time was 30 min late so I had to sit an listen to creepers sex stories.

We all get up and walk up to the strip to get a something to eat. Omfg. The first thing that hit my nose was the sour smell of puke, piss, and shit. There was trash *everywhere* so the smell of rotting trash was also super thick. 

After we ate we decided to go down Hollywood Blvd. It was like experiencing real life pop-up ads. Every wannabe singer had their songs on blast shoving their CDs in your face. One guy even grabbed my arm and yelled into my face how he was the greatest thing since 2Pac. Religious nuts shoving pamphlets at you screeching about how the world was going to end soon. Bums that smelled to high heaven panhandling. Street performers that looked disheveled and tweaked out. It was a nightmare.

Last stop was to head back to the Chinese Theater. Lots of pushing and yelling because people were trying to get pictures in front of it and crouching in front of their favorite stars. 

Overall the day was awful and I just wanted to get out. So we head back and return for diner at night. Just like the day time but exponentially more sketch. More bums,  just mumbling and drunk, pissing on buildings and yelling at strangers. We get around to drinking back at friends place, we're all having a good time when out of nowhere... gunshots right outside the apartment and screeching tires. We look at my friend and she just shrugs like it nothing.

I could not wait to get out of there.

Edit: autocorrect error removed.

I could not wait to get out of there.

author.bio: %access denied%
author.bio_html: %access denied%

body:
Here's a maxim you should remember: **When the Left talks about rules, they are never talking about themselves.**

That's it.  Recite it whenever you see one of these situations, and you'll see it makes perfect sense.  Their rules are for us to follow, they are never for themselves to follow.  Obviously their superior moral leadership makes them exempt.  Once you understand this, the world just got a lot clearer.
body_html:

post.title: Make other people be the change you want to see in the world.

author.bio: %access denied%
author.bio_html: %access denied%

body:
Austin was never leftist, it was *liberal*, and that meant tolerance.  For everyone.  

But that damn SXSW started up, and suddenly tons of people from the rest of the country poured in.  They marveled at what a nice place Austin was, and wanted to move there because where they lived sucked.  Once in Austin, they began turning the place into the shithole they moved from.  The end.
body_html:
Austin was never leftist, it was liberal, and that meant tolerance. For everyone.

But that damn SXSW started up, and suddenly tons of people from the rest of the country poured in. They marveled at what a nice place Austin was, and wanted to move there because where they lived sucked. Once in Austin, they began turning the place into the shithole they moved from. The end.

parent.body:
I grew up there, mid-70s to early-90s. It's always been a shitbox. It's just more of a shitbox and any semblance of resistance to hard-left politics has dried up and moved out of state.

Austin's always been "far left" in comparison to the rest of Texas, but is now alarmingly headed in that direction with the influx of Hollywood "personalities" and rank-and-file Californians, bound and determined to vote for the same idiotic policies that they fled when they left.

I've not spent enough time in New Orleans to formulate an opinion, but the food is out of this world good, I will say that.

post.title: Make other people be the change you want to see in the world.

body:
That's an accurate assessment. As I said in my initial comment it was "far-left" in comparison to the rest of Texas, not actually Leftist (until about 7 years ago).

Or, at least, that's what my outsider's perspective tells me; I've been there fairly often, but have never resided there.

post.title: Make other people be the change you want to see in the world.

author.bio: %access denied%
author.bio_html: %access denied%

body:
Eh, it wasn't left.  There were no riots or people being assholes in public.  It was *liberal*, and that means leaving people alone to do whatever they wanted, be it smoke dope or be straightedge.  Moreover the people were Texans through and through, even if they had different ideas.  They loved barbecue and watched football, etc.  

But the new people are the typical sarcastic, hostile assholes found in California and elsewhere.  There are no limits to immigration, so they could do whatever they want.  Last I heard they bought up all the cheap houses in east Austin, where all the black people used to live (dangerous neighborhoods) and kicked them out.  Because when you're used to California prices, anything else is cheap as hell.
body_html:

body: Lived in different parts of NorCal until recently. The cities are all in terrible condition. The predominantly white areas are super nice but now those people are moving to other states to ruin them.

parent.body:
For anyone that lived in the most liberal part of the country, this is so true it's scary. I've never seen such waste, littering and destruction of the environment as I have in Northern California.

Why is it that you get sick and lightheaded from the pollution in Los Angeles after spending a few hours outside? I remember the northeast corridor (NY/NJ/PA) of the seventies and current CA coast has them beat in terms of garbage and pollution. The place is goddamn disgusting
